IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Evaluation of States in Major Depressive Patients With Cancer, Hospitalized in a Hospital Palliative
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Evaluation of States in Major Depressive Patients With Cancer, Hospitalized in a Hospital Palliative

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: The investigators propose a study that aims to develop a methodology for assessing this risk and the psychological consequences of the malignancy in the palliative phase.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: patients with cancer in palliative cares An interview and will be offered to this patient during his hospitalization to be held (with the collection of personal and family psychiatric history of the patient, family and social context, the assessment of chronic pain and fatigue and quality of life,assessment of anxiety, Evaluation of symptoms of depression,asessment of suicide risk)

ArmGroupInterventionName: Behavioral: interview with a doctor for evaluating suicide risk

Intervention.InterventionName: interview with a doctor for evaluating suicide risk
Intervention.InterventionDescription:
patients with cancer in palliative cares An interview and will be offered to this patient during his hospitalization to be held (with the collection of personal and family psychiatric history of the patient, family and social context, the assessment of chronic pain and fatigue and quality of life,assessment of anxiety, Evaluation of symptoms of depression,asessment of suicide risk)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: assessing the prevalence of suicide risk in patients with cancer admitted to a palliative care service.
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: assessing the prevalence of suicide risk in patients with cancer admitted to a palliative care service.
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: at inclusion only, during hospitalization in palliative cares

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Evaluate the feasibility of a methodology for estimating the risk of suicide in patients with cancer admitted to a palliative care service
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Evaluate the feasibility of a methodology for estimating the risk of suicide in patients with cancer admitted to a palliative care service Questionnaires used are HADS Questionary, Scale HAMILTON, Scale BECK and Scale DUCHER
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: at inclusion only, during hospitalization in palliative cares

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Assess the psychological impact of cancer pathology in patients in palliative
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Assess the psychological impact of cancer pathology in patients in palliative by evaluating depression score (with HADS HAMILTON, BECK, DUCHER scales)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: at inclusion only, during hospitalization in palliative cares

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Identify risk factors for suicide in this patient population
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Identify risk factors for suicide in this patient population with evaluation of type of cancer, psychiatric history, family and social context, quality of life
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: at inclusion only, during hospitalization in palliative cares

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Patient (s) age (s) 18 or more
Patient (s) reach (s) of a cancer palliative stage
Patient (s) hospital (s) in the palliative care service
Patient (s) with cognitive function to an interrogation
Patient (s) having a physical condition for an interview lasting 45 minutes
Patient (s) that received clear information on the diagnosis and prognosis of their disease.
Free and informed consent signed

Exclusion Criteria:

Patient (s) age (s) under 18 years
Patient (s) under supervision or unable to give informed consent
Patient (s) whose cognitive functions do not allow an examination.
EligibilityModule.StudyPopulation: Patients with cancer in palliative cares
